medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient presents with a 2-day history of abdominal pain. Symptoms began the afternoon of the first day with diffuse abdominal pain, followed by nausea and several episodes of non-bloody non-bilious emesis. On the morning of the second day, pain became localized to the right lower quadrant, described as sharp and stabbing, rated (not specified), with no alleviating factors and worsened by movement. Associated symptoms included 7 episodes of non-bloody non-bilious emesis, chills, and dysuria.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Unilateral renal agenesis of left kidney; duodenitis; phimosis; prior circumcision; neurosurgery for tumor in hypothalamus (details not specified).
medical_history.family_history: Father with anxiety and diabetes; mother is healthy. No family history of colon cancer, inflammatory bowel disease (IBD), or diverticulitis.
